t: For the choir director. A psalm of David.
Rescue*pn me, Lord,*s from evil men. Keep*ln me safe from violent men
who*ln plan evil in their hearts. They*ln stir up wars all day long.
They*ln make their tongues as*ln sharp as a snake’s bite; viper’s*ln venom is under their lips. Selah*ig
Protect*pn me, Lord,*s from*ln the power of the wicked. Keep*ln me safe from violent men who*ln plan to make me stumble.
The*ln proud hide a trap with ropes for me; they*ln spread a net along the path and*ln set snares for me. Selah*ig
I*pn say to the Lord,*s “You are my God.” Listen,*ln Lord,*s to my cry for help.
Lord,*sln my Lord, my strong Savior, you*ln shield my head on the day of battle.
Lord,*sln do not grant the desires of the wicked; do*ln not let them achieve their goals. Otherwise,*ln they will become proud. Selah*ig
When*pn those who surround me rise up, may*ln the trouble their lips cause overwhelm them.
Let*ln hot coals fall on them. Let*ln them be thrown into the fire, into*ln the abyss, never again to rise.
Do*ln not let a slanderer stay in the land. Let*ln evil relentlessly hunt down a violent man.
I*pn know that the Lord*s upholds the*ln just cause of the poor, justice*ln for the needy.
Surely*ln the righteous will praise your name; the*ln upright will live in your presence.
